intro: Ballota sepium, commonly known as common ballota, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ballota sepium is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
